subject: Baseball
World Series
lead_paragraph: A full World Series share was worth $351,504 for the Philadelphia Phillies, below the record $362,173 set by the St. Louis Cardinals two years ago. Major League Baseball said the players’ pool for the postseason was $51.16 million, down from $52.46 million last year and a record $55.60 million in 2006. Phillies players received $18.42 million and split it among 45 full shares, 7.039 partial shares and 15 cash awards.
